full_text: Screened by NARA, 7/28/2023 I-589 ADEMDUM PAGE 1 JOSE ANTONIO ROMAN #5 Continued participation with the Somoza Government, I was the only lab specialist with experience of 48 years in the field that remain in the country. In exchange for my freedom I was offered to work with them by training the internatio- nalists who came from communist countries to cooperate with them (Cuban, Russian and Bulgarians) as how to operate the existing laboratory equipment (american-made) Since the majority of the professionals in my field:had fled the country or were imprisoned, my vast experience in all the different fields of bacteriology became indispensable due to the circumstances existing after the civil war the lack of decease control would create a national catastrophe. After having trained the internationalist, my services were no longer necessary in that field, and following instructions from the Chief of the National Security, Lenin Cerna a former paramedic of the Penitentiary System, and now colaborator of the Sandinistas, Efrain Lopez (alias EL CABO) ask me to go into the main jail facility to obtain information who were officers of the National Guard, due to the fact that I was the son of former President, Victor Manuel Roman y Reyes and my years in: the Medical Corps I had their trust. Upon my denial of accepting such offer, I knew I would ran into problems and I decided to find the first opportunity to leave the country and I did 30 days after. #31 Continued I belonged to the Medical Corps of the National Guard during the Somoza Government, I would become on of their "lost" ones. of all the officers who work with me at the same level in the Medical Corps, those who did not leave the country are condemned to 30 years in prison as it Doctor Augusto Flores-Lovo and Dr. Carlos H. Canales who has his house for prison. #34: Continued replaced by General Somoza-Garcia who took power and finish the term. I continued working with the Department of Health and the Penintentiary System for over 30 years until the Sandinistas came into power. I was an active member of the National Liberal Party and I also held the rank of Captain (Medical Corps) of the National Guard until the Sandinista regime came into power abolishing the National Liberal Party and considering all former member of the National Guard under the Somoza Government as criminals. #35 Continued Rene Nunez, Monica Baltodano, Mitchell Najlis and other members of the Sandinista Government now in power. He became their colaborator of the Sandinistas supplying them with information from outside sources We work together for many years and we were close friends. he wanted me toddo the same thing now that the officers of the National Guard were the prisoners. I refused to such offer and it was then that I decided to leave the country fearing imprisonment. As a reward for having serve as an informant to the Sandinistas while he was a member of the National Guard, he d now hold the position of Transportation officer in the Department of Granada.
